text: Ezio Frigerio (16 July 1930 â€“ 2 February 2022) was an Italian costume designer and art director. He was born in Milan, Italy. Frigerio created the sets for Liliana Cavani's movie Galileo e i Cannibali and Jean-Paul Rappeneau's Cyrano de Bergerac, which got an Oscar nomination in 1991. He designed the grave of Rudolf Nureyev. Frigerio also worked with Italian costume designer Franca Squarciapino who was also his life partner. Frigerio died on 2 February 2022 in Lecco, Italy, at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Italian costume designers Category:Artists from Milan Category:Set designers
